subject: Climate & Environment
title: Planned Obsolescence
description: A fast breakdown of Planned Obsolescence for builders.

hook.text: In 1924, light bulb makers agreed to limit bulb life to 1,000 hours. They could last much longer.

buildup.text: Planned obsolescence means designing products to fail or become outdated, forcing replacement.

discovery.text: Smartphones use glued-in batteries and sealed cases â€” repair is deliberately difficult.

twist.text: The EU now requires manufacturers to provide spare parts and repair manuals for appliances.

climax.text: Right-to-repair laws are spreading. Consumers are pushing back against disposable design.

punchline.text: Products don't die naturally. They're designed to.

quiz.question: What is planned obsolescence?
options: Designing products to fail or become outdated intentionally
Products wearing out from natural use
New models being more expensive than old ones
